results.name: default/wordpress-59d768c878-zl78q

error.Text: 0/3 nodes are available: 1 node(s) had untolerated taint {node-role.kubernetes.io/control-plane: }, 2 node(s) had untolerated taint {node.kubernetes.io/not-ready: }. preemption: 0/3 nodes are available: 3 Preemption is not helpful for scheduling.

results.details:
Error: No nodes are available due to taints; 1 node is a control plane, and 2 nodes are not ready. Preemption isn't helping.

Solution: 
1. Check node taints with `kubectl describe node`.
2. Remove taints with `kubectl taint nodes <node-name> <taint-key>-`.
3. Ensure nodes are ready with `kubectl get nodes`.

results.name: default/wordpress

error.Text: Service has no endpoints, expected label app=wordpress

results.details:
Error: The service can't find any pods because there are no endpoints with the label app=wordpress.

Solution: 
1. Check if pods have the label app=wordpress.
2. If not, add the label to the pods.
3. Ensure the selector in the service matches the pod labels.
4. Redeploy the service if needed.
